Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.5663, and the Assembly Committee on Rules, A.8813, “AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to exempting certain clothing and footwear sales and uses from local sales and compensating use taxes imposed in or by any city having a population of one million or more”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm

Items.MatterName: Exempting certain clothing and footwear sales from taxes.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to conforming the unincorporated business tax to the general corporation tax with respect to the source of receipts from personal services and the inclusion of rented tangible personal property in the property allocation factor, and making formula allocation the preferred method for taxpayers subject to the unincorporated business tax, and allowing certain existing partnerships to continue to use the books and records allocation  method for a seven-year period; makes technical corrections relating thereto;  and  to repeal certain provisions of such code relating to the unincorporated business pertaining to leveraged buy-out transactions.” A.8434 / S.5568
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Conforming the unicorporated tax to the general corporation tax.

Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Amend the real property tax law.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senators Duane, Andrews, Dilan, Hassell-Thompson, Krueger, Montgomery, Oppenheimer, Parker, Sabini, Sampson and Schneiderman, S.5157, “AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, the administrative code of the city of New York, the retirement and social security law and the education law, in relation to providing special accidental death benefits and accidental death benefits to registered domestic partners of deceased members of the New York city police pension fund, subchapter two, the New York city fire department pension fund, subchapter two, the New York city employees’ retirement system, the New York city teachers’ retirement system and the board of education retirement system of the city of New York”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Providing special accidental death benefits  and accidental death benefits to registered domestic partners of deceased members of the NYC police pension fund,  subchapter two,  the NYC fire department pension fund.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Heastie, A.4407, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to discontinue the use as parkland a portion of real property in the borough of the Bronx and to use such property, as well as property under the jurisdiction of the city of New York department of transportation, for expansion and improvement of the Gun Hill Road subway station, in and around the intersection of White Plains Road and Gun Hill Road in exchange for the dedication of certain other land in the borough of the Bronx for park purposes”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Expansion and improvement of the Gun Hill Road subway station.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by the Senate Committee on Rules, S.5818, and the Assembly Committee on Rules, A.8932, “AN ACT authorizing the leasing of certain parkland and demapping of certain streets for development of a professional baseball stadium and associated facilities in and in the vicinity of Macombs Dam Park and John Mullaly Park in the borough of the Bronx in the city of New York, and to authorize the state to dispose of  certain surplus lands to the city of New  York to provide for new park facilities”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Leasing of certain parkland and demapping of certain streets for development of a professional baseball stadium.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the tax law, the administrative code of the city of New York, chapter 877 of the laws of 1975, chapter 880 of the laws of 1975, chapter 884 of the laws of 1975, and chapter 882 of the laws of 1977, all relating to the imposition of certain taxes in the city of New York, in relation to postponing the expiration of certain tax rates and taxes in the city of New York.” A.8780 / S.5617
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Relating to the imposition of certain taxes in NYC.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Dilan S.1081 and Assembly Member Robinson A.2014, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner George Black, or if he is deceased, to the person or persons who would have inherited said property from him or to their successor in interest, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 1762, Lot No. 62 on tax map for the borough of Brooklyn.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: In Rem, George Black, Brooklyn

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Smith, S.2706 and Assembly Member Scarborough, A.5541 “AN ACT authorizing its interest in certain real property acquired in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Queens to former owner Siraj Wahhaj, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 12332, Lot No. 154 on tax map for the borough of Queens”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: In rem tax foreclose in Queens, Former owner Siraj Wahhaj

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the rate of regular interest used in the actuarial valuation of liabilities for the purpose of calculating contributions to the New York city employees' retirement system, the New York city teachers' retirement system, the police pension fund, subchapter two, the fire department pension fund, subchapter two and the board of education retirement system of such city by public employers and other obligors required to make employer contributions to such retirement systems, and the crediting of special interest and additional interest to members of such retirement systems, and the allowance of supplementary interest on the funds of such retirement systems.” A.8811 / S.5672
